Dundee drug discovery firm Exscientia raises $60 million ... raises $60 million by Rob McLaren May 26 2020, 5.34pm Updated: May 26 2020, 5.36pm Chief executive and founder of Exscientia Professor Andrew Hopkins. Dundee-based drugs discovery company Exscientia has raised $60 million in its latest financing round. The staggering sum realised by the Dundee University spin-out was led by new investor Novo Holdings, with existing investors Evotec, Bristol Myers Squibb, and GT Healthcare Capital also participating in the Series C round. Exscientia, which operates from River Court at City Quay, and Oxford, said the new capital will be used to expand its product pipeline and to launch new products.
